title: Question 19
prompt: While in Korea, the students <u>is expected</u> to keep up with their studies.
description: Read the sentence and look at the underlined parts. Choose the answer that is written correctly for each underlined part.
feedback: The subject “students” is plural, so it needs a plural verb. The sentence is also describing something that is currently happening while they are in Korea, so it needs a present tense verb. The correct verb is “are expected.” The verb “is expected” is singular. The verb “were expecting” is past tense. The verb “are expecting” indicates something that the students expect, not something the students are expected to do, so it is also incorrect.
